meanings.definition: Soft, downy hair that covers the body of a fetus or newborn baby.
meanings.sent1: The tiny baby had a layer of lanugo on his delicate skin.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that lanugo helps keep newborns warm.
meanings.sent3: The lanugo on the baby's back made him look like a little bear.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as soft as lanugo, giving her a gentle appearance.
meanings.sent5: The lanugo on the baby's head was so fine, it felt like a whisper against your fingertips.

meanings.definition: Fine, silky hair that grows on plants or animals.
meanings.sent1: The lanugo on the leaves of the plant shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit's lanugo was so soft to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The lanugo on the cat's tail looked like delicate threads of silk.
meanings.sent4: The lanugo on the flower petals added a touch of elegance to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The lanugo on the puppy's ears was like a soft cloud framing its face.
